p: The conventional preparations of α-aminophosphonates and related derivatives are the Kabachnik–Fields (phospha-Mannich) reaction, in which an amine, an oxo-compound, and a >P(O)H derivative react with each other [ 10, 11], and the aza-Pudovik reaction, in which a >P(O)H reagent is added on the C=N double bond of an imine [ 12].
